page.title: 14Ecology
page.content: Like other areas of chalk downland, agriculture has claimed many acres of interesting grassland and woodland. There are however still some good areas left to the east of the River Stour. Species-rich grassland has various varieties of orchid, some on their northern European limit and typical flowers like marjoram, which during the summer months attract many different butterflies, one of the most familiar and typical being some of the blue species. There are also many insects. Some good woodland still remains, which attracts birds like the nightingale and blackcap. Olantigh Towers is still surrounded by parkland, which has fine specimen trees and where some interesting plants are still found. The finest remnants of chalk grassland and woodland are S.S.S.I.
